name: RP Out of Pocket Medical v.15.01
description:
Out of Pocket Medical v.1.0 is a transition from a RP Kill/Tax deck that just wasn't working. It was my first attempt to go all in on tax.

I decided to move away from Nisei MK II because I felt that 6 4/2 agendas made it harder to get to match point. With 2 Shi.Kyūs working in concert with Komainu the Runner would still need 4 agendas to win even if they managed to steal a The Future Perfect.

Scoring or having Medical Breakthrough stolen means that I can never advance the next one in a scoring server and once that one is scored/stolen I can score the final Medical Breakthrough from hand.

That means that I usually can get to 4 AP quickly and threaten to win when I create a scoring window for one of my The Future Perfects. A taxing server with Ash 2X3ZB9CY and/or Caprice Nisei can score a 5/3 just as easily as a 5/3. I can even "bait" the run with NAPD Contract and by the time they "steal" it from me they are so broke I can install advance, advance a The Future Perfect and score it next turn. Medical costs hurt.

This build didn't last long as the Inazumas were not really geared for the taxing nature of the deck and Encryption Protocol wasn't pulling it's weight. I wanted more ICE and one more Shi.Kyū. The question was what ICE was I going to bring in?

name: RP Out of Pocket Medical v.15.02
description:
Agendas: I lay out why I am not using Nisei MK II in V.1.0 of this deck. Read it there.

Basic strategy, score a 4/2 as soon as it is possible. If the runner steals the first one, no sweat they have either made your next Medical Breakthrough cheaper to score or have drained their economy paying for a NAPD Contract and opened a scoring window for another 4/2 agenda. You want to get to 4 AP as quickly as possible so that the runner feels pressure to run your servers rather than sitting back counting their money waiting to pounce. A poor Runner is a very sad Runner against this deck.

I rarely try to push a 5/2 out in the early game as they are just too vulnerable. I wait until my economy is humming and I have a solid scoring server setup with Ash 2X3ZB9CY and/or Caprice Nisei ideally or I sacrifice a NAPD Contract to open a scoring window.

Changes: I dumped Encryption Protocol and having freed up influence I cast about for ICE to replace them.

Not one to believe the hype about how useless a card is I saw some potential in Hourglass. Normally, you can wait for a 4th click run and completely ignore this card and that really does suck in most decks. However, in a horizontal deck where clicks are a premium it becomes a serious liability to the runner. You either focus on Centrals and my drip econ runs wild or you pay a hefty price to break it and then run on my servers.

I am not sure why I put Neural Katana in my deck. Perhaps I was unwilling to let go of the kill and tax origins of this deck... I used it once to good effect but as a singleton is was rarely a difference maker like Tollbooth or Wall of Thorns.

Let’s talk about Interns. I am sure some folks would disagree with my choice and would rather have some sort of burst econ instead. They are invaluable to the taxing nature of this deck. Interns allows you to let Jackson Howard to be trashed, costing the runner 3 precious credits that could have been used to steal an agenda or trash my drip assets. Now I can bring back a Jackson anytime I need one from the archive. If the Jacksons are safe I can stack ICE without draining my early econ. You can also bring back Ash or Caprice which really pisses runners off.

This deck performed well never dropping a game but I needed to tweek the ICE, bring on V.1.2!

name: Sneaky
Tenma Accounting - 7/5/2014
White is the New Black v2
description: My most recent iteration of RP. Posted to link elsewhere, but feedback is always welcome.

name: My First Tenma
description:
My first Tenma deck, and I'd love some feedback. I've had some good luck on OCTGN so far and am hoping to get some insight to tune it up.

Nothing to crazy, I don't think, but so far it's a quick rig to set up and I tend to have great money and efficient breakers. Here are some considerations:

  • No Plascretes + AS = Scary. Might add two in, and remove...

  • Kati Jones. Doesn't feel synergistic or necessary (in the 5 games I've played so far, I never put her out, and never needed to). That said, she's the only permanent source of cash flow, so I'm a little afraid to take her out completely.

  • I want a 3rd Desperado for Christmas

Thanks for input!

name: Qu'est-ce que c'est
description:
What I want to do is Psycho out a Private Security Force and then just click meat damage all day.

What usually ends up happening is I Psycho-Beale on a smallish server with an Ash.

Either way is fine, but I'm sure it could use improvement...and a playset of Bad Times

name: HB True Glacier
description:
1. You go cred, cred, install the entire game.
  2. Never ever clickdraw. It exposes R&D agendas for the stealing. To not draw cards is your strongest R&D defense.
  3. Expect all the agendas in the first 15 cards you see to be stolen. If they are not stolen, it is a bonus.
  4. Ice HQ thoughtfully and mind your credits vs siphon, so that after rez, the siphon doesn't get 5. After 1-2 ice are rezzed on HQ, siphons become unprofitable.
  5. To set up a reclamation for 2/3 cards, you need to finish a turn with 4/3 cards.
  6. Install howler as the first or second ice and don't rez it except to counter legwork/fullsiphon. Place taxing ice(tollbooth,ichi2,janus,heimdall2,wotan) in front of howler, let the runner pay to get through the taxing ice, then rez something expensive with howler so the runner wastes the money getting through the first ice.

name: Jinkteki II: The Return of Jinteki
description: basic attack/trap deck, with advancement tokens for all

description:
Enigma and Eli 1.0 replaced Ichi 2.0 and Viktor 2.0 to screw with Katman.

name: HB True Glacier v1.3
description:
Latest: Ice changes to screw with katman. +3 Ichi2 to go up to 19 taxing ice, so that 12 taxing ice are expected to be drawn by end game, Archives 2, R&D 3, HQ 3, Remote 3, with 1 spare.

  1. You go cred, cred, install the entire game.

  2. Never ever clickdraw. It exposes R&D agendas for the stealing. To not draw cards is your strongest R&D defense.

name: Bullet to the Face
description: Recently edited my deck. I am still rather new but I am learning. This is a hybrid deck built to either play as tag n bag or big ice, although leaning toward tag n bag (big ice is contingency). overall this deck has moderately high success. I only have lost against multiple account siphon runs. I have been playing alot more, learning alot more, and finally i can stop an account siphon run... sometimes. But i have figured out how to bounce back using mining corp. I love this deck and it is so fun to play. I keep hesitating on taking out the vulcans for a single gov contract and two other cards, but then this deck doesnt have the feel that I wanted to.

name: Milldromeda v1
description:
Running is annoying and expensive. Let's just put R&D into archives instead.

This is the version I took to Melbourne's regionals on 2014-07-05.

Basically you want to chain-Account-Siphon the corp into submission, get 3 of (Data Leak Reversal, Fall Guy) on the table and go nuts. You'll usually hit 12+ cards even if the corp makes a serious effort to stop you. Joshua B. makes a bad leak worse and can give you that first tag in a pinch. Protect him with Fall Guys if you can, but it's better to let him go if it means you can leak out more cards. Feint is in to enable Emergency Shutdown and connect Data Leak Reversal if you're desperate. Vamp works best with either Magnum Opus or a lucky run of economy events, giving you a chance to chase down a rich corp.

Unless you can go for the full deck, don't spend all your clicks on Data Leak Reversal. Draw, leak 4; virus counter on Crypsis, leak 4; Opus, leak 4; any of these are better turns as they build your position while the corp tries to recover.

Logos is the key. I'll often let the corp go poor to score the first agenda, grab something useful and then put them into the ground. This is a lot harder against NBN, of course, but I have successfully leaked out entire FAstroBiotics decks.

Keep an Easy Mark in-hand to recover from Closed Accounts, unless you have Opus on the table. With Joshua B. out, you can go Easy Mark -> Credit -> Credit -> Sure Gamble -> Run from 0 credits.

Common targets for Logos are:

  • Opus
  • Account Siphon
  • The Source
  • Fall Guy

Usually you'll want Opus First, so that you're economically set for the rest of the game. Then pull The Source to stop the corp winning, if you haven't got one already.

Click to draw early and often. It's fine, really. Logos for the Quality Time if you're desperate.

I've since replaced the 2x Plascrete Carapace with 2x Forged Activation Orders. Testing has shown that I can keep most corps poor enough that double-scorch isn't an option, but you can dodge single Scorch with a full grip.

name: Custom Biotics Shutdown Recursion v1
description:
This is the version I took to Melbourne's regionals on 2014-07-05. Usually my decks have some kind of linked theme. This time it seemed to be "put everything in Archives".

Basically you want to have a Power Shutdown on hand at all times. Shut down anything. Shut down everything! Shut down Prepaid VoicePADs, Datasuckers, Clone Chips, Faeries, Self-Modifying Codes, anything costing less than or equal to 3. Eventually you'll break a critical part of their rig and they'll be locked out.

Well, that's the theory, anyway. In practice, this deck stunk. I wound up shutting down my other shutdowns, or my Jacksons, or all my ICE, or all my agendas. The Restructure was a bad idea, because I was either swimming in money (and didn't need it), or I was way too poor.

Choosing Private Contracts over Eve Campaign was a meta call: I was expecting Security Testing, and you can clear out a Private Contracts very quickly if you have to. I'm happy with that decision.

name: Melbourne Regionals Top 8 - Stephen Nash Corp
Melbourne Regionals Top 8 - Stephen Nash Runner
Melbourne Regionals Top 8 - Liam Prasad Runner
Melbourne Regionals Top 8 - Liam Prasad Corp
Melbourne Regionals Top 8 - Sohum Banerjea Runner
Melbourne Regionals Top 8 - Jason Ryan Runner
Melbourne Regionals Top 8 - Jason Ryan Corp
Melbourne Regionals Top 8 - Matthew Leong Runner
Melbourne Regionals Top 8 - Matthew Leong Corp
Melbourne Regionals Top 8 - Andrew Banh Runner
Melbourne Regionals Top 8 - Andrew Banh Corp
Melbourne Regionals Top 8 - Giles Adams Runner
Melbourne Regionals Top 8 - Giles Adams Corp
Doppler Effect
description:
Yo dog, maybe this will work better than what you were running last night.

Since you're using Doppelgänger anyway, you might as well try Notoriety. Combined with Early Bird and All-nighter you can should be able to pretty easily score them. Emergency Shutdown and Crescentus will keep the runs cheap by derezzing expensive ice. Since Gabriel Santiago: Consummate Professional and Desperado go together like jack and coke, you might as well switch to Andromeda: Dispossessed Ristie for that sweet, sweet 9 card hand start.

Econ: You were always running poor, so let's throw in a couple Bank Jobs. Plop one down and access the same turn for a quick boost. The Cyberfeeders will help keep you money in your pocket.

Programs: That Leviathan wasn't doing you any favors, so maybe try the central only breaker suite. Get the Alias out early (with Special Order if necessary) to protect from sentries, followed up by Breach and ZU.13 Key Master to get past ETR ice. My boy ZU.13 and Crypsis can get you into remotes in emergencies. ZU.13 is also handy because once you've got Doppleganger out, he won't take up any memory. Save the Femme Fatale for particularly heinous ice you don't want to deal with - short of Levy AR Lab Access you've only got the one. That's the other reason I suggest getting a sentry breaker out first - you've only got one of each breaker, and you do NOT want to lose one to a Rototurret on turn one.

name: Giraffe Memories (1st place, Montreal Regionals 2014)
description: Use Celebrity Gift and show many varied ice so the runner doesn't know what to expect. Hoard credits so the runner fears Midseason Replacements. Overdraw with Jackson Howard then use Archived Memories to play whatever operations you need at the time.

name: Countess Kate (1st place, Montreal Regionals 2014)
description: Build up a large economy with Professional Contacts, Prepaid VoicePAD, and money events, then Vamp and run anywhere.

name: Med Coats
description: Jinteki tax deck which uses Harmony Medtech as the identity to put even more pressure on the runner.

name: Information Specialist
description:
I play poorly against traps. Its a problem. Lets try to solve it.

  1. Get Money
  2. Get Breakers
  3. Know what every card on the table is.
  4. Maybe keep the corp poor
  5. Run

Problems with this current build:

  1. No multi-access
  2. No surprises (inside job, stimhack, indexing, etc.)
  3. Will get owned by fast-advance

Can they be solved? Is this even the right ID? Faction?

name: Smash and Grab
description: So heres the idea behind this deck. Laramy fisk's ability means that when you use medium you can force them to draw a card so you see two new cards instead of one. Alternating between running the two servers forces them to wipe and if they don't you can Demolition Run huge chunks of combo pieces, econ and Ice out of their decks and then follow it with seeing even more new cards. I basically wanted to force them to wipe virus counters, flood their hq with agendas or just let me tear through their deck.

name: Lucky Streak
Kit
description:
Here is my take on a Kit Yog/Parasite deck. Nothing special here Yog should be your primary breaker where possible, using parasite to try an keep the ice from getting too deep, use Cyber Cypher and Atman where necessary to fill in gaps. I went with a Magnum as the many money maker which I’m a little nervous about because until you see at least 1 of the memory card the memory is going to be VERY tight. I went with personal touch over Dino because the only reason this deck would play scavenge is to move Yog on top of Dino and that seemed like a bit of a waste.

I know I’m not the first person to try this idea so if anyone who has more experience with this kind of build wants to comment that would be great.

name: The Grand National Psi Games 2.0
description:
So Originally this was a quickly put together gimmick deck. After taking it out for a whirl i found i enjoyed it and did rather well.

I think their is potential here with some polish it could be potent. I've made a few changes to the deck to add some surprises.

Any input welcome.

name: Real girls play with Blackguards
description: This is an idea I have been playing around with after playing PeekaySK's Big Girls Play With Monoliths - http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/808/big-girls-play-with-monoliths#. The basic idea is to sweep through the deck once selling programs to FCC to build credits then Levy once blackguard is out. Still not too sure if the econ is there yet. Any comments appreciated :)

name: Virus Override
description: The idea is to mill the corp's deck, not really worried about making runs, just mill and mill, haven't tested it yet.

name: Wilson's got new gear 1.2
description: Based on "Noisy Find".

name: Shaper Core Set
description:
Follows the basic Shaper idea from the core set while making a few minor changes that really speed up the process of getting an ICE cutting rig.

Mimic replaces Pipeline since the majority of sentries I encounter are strength 3 or 4. #ce Carver comes in to give Mimic the boost it needs to really excel (Personal Touche can be added too, in case you really need to break a Heimdal).

The other two additions are Sneakdoor Beta, in order to put some pressure on the Archives after R&D and HQ have been ICEd, and Deja Vu, which exists to make you more comfortable trashing cards as you burn through your deck, and makes trashed programs less of a crippling worry in this icebreaker heavy deck.

I've played this against core set decks and expansion-based decks, and it seems to hold its own. Any comments/suggestions are welcome, either playing against Core or against expansion decks, but I'd prefer to keep the card content to core-only cards.

name: Grndl Supermodernism V. Mine
description: Based Somewhat on RoyalRatAuthority's My Supermodernism Which is then loosely derived from Alsciende's Supermodernism V2

name: Underworld Overmind
description:
Totally untested. Basic idea is a couple beneficial interactions. The deck might not want a second Capstone.

The high link protects you from traces when you have a spinal modern.

Helpful AI helps you manipulate Atman.

The cloud icebreakers free MU for Overmind.

The S&W is there because I like the card and I find Caprice annoying.

name: Weyland Mindgames
description:
Who ever said that Jinteki has the copyright on mindgames? Mushin No Shin allows for some pretty awesome plays in any faction-- Pick a card from HQ, Mushin it, and advance it once more. As long as expose is out of your meta (as it is for me), you can often score big agendas completely naked, allowing you to focus more on icing up your central servers. From my experience people are typically terrified of running on any quadruple advanced card, unless it's match point, for fear of an instant flatline. I often pick an agenda and a trap in my hand and randomly shuffle them before installing, so that not even I know which card I just installed.

TRAPS:

Junebug: Threatens instant flatline against anyone without Deus X, provided you have at least 1 credit

Cerebral Overwrite: Severely limits anything the runner does and threatens flatline later on; 4 brain damage is nothing to sneeze at

GRNDL Refinery: Not really a trap, but it's an advancable asset. With Mushin you can potentially get 24 credits out of this

AGENDAS:

Project Atlas: Overscored, lets you say "I win" down the line. You can grab SEA Source, Scorched Earths, more Mushins, you name it, exactly when you need them. With Jackson Howard on the table, you have access to anything you want in either R&D or Archives. Another bonus is that you show it to the runner, so you can grab a trap/agenda and Mushin for more mindgames.

Hostile Takeover: Fast money and Archer Fodder

Government Contracts: Helps with the money game

The Cleaners: Makes Scorched Earth even scarier

Posted Bounty: If they don't steal it, you can score it at the start of your next turn and potentially play 3 Scorched Earths, even if they're ahead in the money game

ICE:

Mostly inexpensive so we don't go broke. Ice Wall, Quandary, and Guard are great to place after a Mushin play early in the game if you expect expose capabilities. Getting an overscored Project Atlas, a Government Contracts, or The Cleaners early in the game gives a big advantage. Hunter is also very cheap to rez, and expensive to break, since most runners likely won't want tags against Weyland

But we also have some heavier ice in Archer, Hive, and Hadrian's to defend R&D/HQ.

I have yet to playtest this; comments and suggestions are appreciated!

name: weyland teaching deck
description: simple weyland deck for teaching new players. no tracing or tagging + the only damage is via rototurret or junebug. big 3-point agendas so that you have to build a remote server, and also so that the game doesn't take too long. all code gates within yog range to keep it simple.

name: gabe teaching deck
description: simple breaker suite, designed to be a companion to my teaching weyland deck - everything in there is broken efficiently by one of these breakers. lots of cards which encourage runs. tri-maf is there to teach about meat damage mostly when they wear tags from siphon, plus because it's a good economy card. sneakdoor because it feels super good for new players (and old players, actually) to chuck it down and start getting free HQ runs. i also picked Gabe rather than Kate because i feel like he more quickly delivers the immediately fun part of netrunner, e.g. running constantly and not giving an eff about anything.

name: Virus Override 0.1
Ken Events Edit 1 - Ginseng version
description: Temporary.

name: New Weyland - Mushin no Shin splash
description: Temporary

name: Haas Learner
Kate Learner
